This fast, intuitive, detailed, and accurate weather app is trusted by professional pilots, paragliders, skydivers, kiters, surfers, boaters, fishermen, storm chasers, and weather geeks, as well as by governments, army staff and rescue teams.

Whether you are tracking a tropical storm or potential severe weather, planning a trip, pursuing your favorite outdoor sport, or you just need to know if it will rain this weekend, Windy provides you with the most up-to-date weather forecast around.

The uniqueness of Windy lies in the fact that it brings you better quality information than the other weather apps’ pro-features, while our product is absolutely free to use and ad-free as well.

Powerful, smooth, and fluid presentation makes weather forecasting a real pleasure!

ALL FORECAST MODELS SIMULTANEOUSLY

Thermometer shows the current outdoor temperature, humidity, and pressure at your location. It gets weather data from the nearby weather stations.

You can switch between Celsius and Fahrenheit degrees and choose a location on a map.

Barometer Plus app measures air pressure and altitude using your device's built-in barometric pressure sensor.
Because air pressure changes usually indicate a weather change, you can use this app to monitor and predict short-term weather variations.
People suffering from migraine, headaches, or joint pain can monitor how barometric pressure impacts their mood.
Fishermen can monitor the atmospheric pressure for right-time fishing.

FEATURES:
• The app contains a barometer and altimeter with a personalization graphic in classic analog style. It also displays the current temperature and humidity.
• Display barometric pressure (sensor value) or mean sea level pressure (MSLP - value used in weather forecast services or stations).
• Units support for pressure: mb, inHg, kPa, atm, Torr, psi, hPa, mmHg. Units for altitude: meter, feet.
• Calibrate the barometer using altitude/location from the GPS. Calibrate the altimeter using the nearest airport information/METAR, or manually enter the QNH of the nearest airport. Offset sensor output value.
• Measure the height (building/mountain/hiked/climbed) using the "Relative Altitude" feature (can be enabled in the app's Settings).
• Notification about pressure change. "Notification custom rule" for you to define how and when the app sends notifications.
Notify when air pressure changes indicate that extreme or worse weather may occur.
• "Pressure Tracking" and "History Graph" require "Background App Refresh" or "Always Location Service" with "Exact update interval" (paid feature) enabled.
• "My Area" allows you to define your frequent stay places, and the app tracks air pressure with location data.
• Export history to CSV format and Today widget (paid features).
• This app is the digital version compared with an aneroid or mercury barometer and can be adjusted to MSLP with additional features.

CUSTOMIZABLE:
You can change your barometer/altimeter appearance with:
• Seven different housing colors.
• Black, white or blue disk background.
• Four different app backgrounds.
• Three different types of needles.
• Marker needle for easily monitor.
• Dark or light Today widget theme.

NOTES:
• App only works on devices with a barometer sensor, such as iPhone 6/6s/7/8/X/11/12/13 (including Plus models), iPad Mini 4/Air 2/Pro, or later.
• Weather icons on the dial: This only shows the air pressure trend like in an analog barometer.
• Each time your device reboots, open the app for tracking with the "Exact update interval" feature work.
• You may take the phone/tablet far away from computers, cables, and other magnetic sources to get accurate results.

If you like this app, please support us - you can remove ads or unlock paid features from the menu: Shop.
We welcome your ideas and suggestions - please email us at: support+barometer@pvdapps.com.
Follow our official Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/barometerplus/ or Twitter account: https://twitter.com/pvdapps.

Tide Guide is made to help water lovers, beach-goers, boatsmen, and surfers quickly understand their local marine environment by presenting tide times, surf reports, water heights, and solunar events alongside a detailed forecast and interactive wave chart. It is designed to be simple and intuitive, with easy access to thousands of different tide stations around the world.

Data is provided by world renowned organizations such as NOAA, the UK Hydrographic Office, the Canadian Hydrographic Service, the GNW, DWD, and others.


# Powerful Widgets
Add beautiful and powerful widgets to your home screen or lock screen wallpaper. An extensive set of widgets, with powerful customization options allow for endless combinations of marine and tide conditions.


# Live Activities
Use Live Activities to follow the current marine and tide conditions. There are different options for various “island activities.” Track the current tide, wind conditions, solar progress, or lunar phase.

# Built for Apple Watch
Add beautiful complications to your watch face to track the current tide, solar progress, lunar phase, and more. A native Apple Watch app helps check current conditions while your in the field.

# Summary Shortcuts
Use Siri or the Shortcuts app to view different summaries of the tide, surf conditions, upcoming forecasts, and more. Ask Siri “Tide Guide Surf Report” to never miss the next swell.


# Lunar Calendar
Easily track the current lunar phase with a beautiful lunar phase calendar. Explore the altitude and elevation of the moon throughout the day, and view detailed solunar times like nautical dawn, dusk, and more.

Moon Phases Calendar - universal lunar calendar for any Locations from 0001 to 2100 years.

Plan. File. Fly. Log.

Garmin Pilot is the most comprehensive suite of tools for the iPad designed specifically for general aviation and corporate pilots. Flight planning, charts, interactive maps, weather briefing resources and navigation capabilities; it’s all included. The app’s intuitive interface mirrors those on the newest Garmin touchscreen avionics so you can go seamlessly from preflight to inflight.  

Plan 

Garmin Pilot’s powerful capabilities start with pre-flight planning, providing pilots with the most comprehensive aviation weather information to make better-informed flight decisions. Pilots can check NEXRAD radar, visible and infrared cloud imagery, METARs, TAFs, AIRMETs, SIGMETs, PIREPs, NOTAMs, winds and temperature aloft, TFRs and lightning data. With Garmin Pilot, data can be displayed over Garmin’s interactive maps that support track-up navigation, VFR sectional or an IFR low or high en-route chart to visualize the weather for your route. Add text-based weather widgets and use the exclusive NavTrack feature to view weather along the planned route. 

File 

With Garmin Pilot, users can easily enter a flight plan and interactively edit it on the map. Pre-loaded forms make it quick to save and reuse data for frequently flown routes. And when the flight plan is ready, Garmin Pilot makes it simple to file, amend or close the flight plan via Leidos Flight Service or DUATS.  

Fly 

Garmin Pilot provides full en-route navigation capability on its moving map. Pilots can also navigate with Garmin’s patented panel, a GPS-driven instrument pack with a graphical HSI directional display and indicators for groundspeed, altitude and vertical speed. After takeoff, pilots can continue to view real-time weather in the U.S. and traffic information by wirelessly connecting to Garmin’s GDL 39 3D portable ADS-B Receiver (sold separately). 

Log

Garmin Pilot includes a comprehensive electronic logbook that syncs with flyGarmin.  The logbook automatically generates entries based upon GPS data collected during the flight, tracks currency, supports manual entries, endorsements and creates reports.

Climate is the statistics of weather over long periods of time. It is measured by assessing the patterns of variation in temperature, humidity, atmospheric pressure, wind, precipitation, atmospheric particle count and other meteorological variables in a given region over long periods of time. Climate differs from weather, in that weather only describes the short-term conditions of these variables in a given region.

A region's climate is generated by the climate system, which has five components: atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere.

The climate of a location is affected by its latitude, terrain, and altitude, as well as nearby water bodies and their currents. Climates can be classified according to the average and the typical ranges of different variables, most commonly temperature and precipitation. The most commonly used classification scheme was the Köppen climate classification. The Thornthwaite system, in use since 1948, incorporates evapotranspiration along with temperature and precipitation information and is used in studying biological diversity and how climate change affects it. The Bergeron and Spatial Synoptic Classification systems focus on the origin of air masses that define the climate of a region.

Paleoclimatology is the study of ancient climates. Since direct observations of climate are not available before the 19th century, paleoclimates are inferred from proxy variables that include non-biotic evidence such as sediments found in lake beds and ice cores, and biotic evidence such as tree rings and coral. Climate models are mathematical models of past, present and future climates. Climate change may occur over long and short timescales from a variety of factors; recent warming is discussed in global warming. Global warming results in redistributions.

Du erhältst stundengenaue Wettervorhersagen für jeden Ort in Deutschland und auch für Europa! So weißt Du ganz genau, was Dich erwartet und bist für jede Wetterlage bestens gerüstet.


Das reicht dir nicht? Kein Problem: Schau dir das Wetter für die ganze Welt in der 15-Tage-Vorschau an. So kannst Du besser planen, was Du für den Urlaub einpacken solltest und kannst jeder Wetterlage trotzen. Und wenn Du schon dort bist – ob das Regenwetter einen Museumsbesuch oder der Sonnenschein historisches Sightseeing nahelegt, erfährst du bei uns.


Die wetter.de App ist genau für Dich gemacht! Wenn Du Allergiker bist, kannst Du dir mit unserem Pollenflug stundengenau ansehen, ob mit Heuschnupfen zu rechnen ist. Und wenn Du schlecht schlafen kannst, wenn Vollmond ist: Unsere Wetter App zeigt dir die jeweilige Mondphase an.


Selbst wenn das Wetter mal schlecht ist, informieren wir Dich darüber. Wo mit Unwetter, starkem Niederschlag oder Schnee zu rechnen ist, zeigt Dir unsere Wetter App täglich und stundengenau an. So weißt Du immer, wann Du das Auto in der Garage stehen lassen solltest. Und der Regenradar informiert Dich darüber, wann genau Du einen Regenschirm einpacken musst. Damit Du auch immer auf dem neusten Stand bist, halten Dich unsere Push-Nachrichten bei relevanten News auf dem Laufenden.


Mit unserer Wetter App erwarten Dich weitere tolle Features und Wetterinformationen. Unsere Wetterprofile zeigen dir zu jeder Gelegenheit das passende Wetter. Du willst grillen oder doch lieber baden gehen? Schau dir das Wetterprofil an und die Entscheidung wird dir abgenommen. Neben dem Grillprofil und Badewetter haben wir noch das Gartenwetter, das Wanderwetter, das Skiprofil, das Gesundheitswetter und den Pollenflug.


Möchtest Du uns Feedback zur App geben? Wir freuen uns auf Deine E-Mail an appfeedback@wetter.de


Nutze auch unser umfangreiches Angebot auf www.wetter.de!

Kelikamerat näyttää Liikenneviraston tiekamerakuvat, säätiedot ja tiejaksokohtaiset sääennusteet sijaintisi perusteella. Tiekameroiden lisäksi kartalta löytyy myös muita kameroita kaupungeissa, hiihtokeskuksissa ja saaristossa. Kameroita on yhteensä yli 1100 ja kiinnostavimmat voit lisätä suosikkilistalle.

Kamerakuvakkeen yläpuolella näkyy ilman ja alapuolella tienpinnan lämpötila. Säätiedot voi vaihtaa koskettamalla karttaa vähintään sekunnin ajan. Monissa paikoissa on useisiin suuntiin kuvaavia kameroita. Haluttu kamera valitaan koskettamalla kuvaketta useita kertoja.

Tiekamerakuvan koskettaminen aloittaa ja lopettaa enintään 10 viimeisimmän kuvan toiston. Muiden kameroiden kuvat haetaan sekunnin välein riippumatta kameran päivitystaajuudesta.

Kaikki kamerat eivät aina ole käytössä esimerkiksi ukkosen aiheuttamien rikkoontumisten välttämiseksi tai häiriöiden/huoltotöiden vuoksi.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Kelikamerat+ allows you to see weather forecasts, browse the road cameras (operated by Finnish Transport Agency) and their weather information around your location. There are also other cameras in the cities, ski resorts and archipelago. The number of cameras is currently 1100 and the interesting ones can be added to the Favorites list.

Air and road temperatures are shown along with the camera icon. Weather information can be changed by touching the map at least one second. Some locations are equipped with several cameras pointing to the different directions. The desired camera is selected by touching the camera icon multiple times. 

A touch of the image starts/stops the playback of the sequence (max. 10 recent images). The images of the other cameras are reloaded once a second despite the actual refresh rate.

Smile every time you check the weather!
